paragraphs.text: Between the article and the comments it appears that the story is about how stupid Trump and most of the republicans are…. oh, and there we some side notes about renewable energy thrown in there somewhere.

paragraphs.name: 0c24
paragraphs.text: Is there any hope of unbundling the two? I like to read and learn, but if every good thing I encounter has a parenthetical “Trump Sucks” qualifier I feel like the target of propaganda.

paragraphs.name: 13e0
paragraphs.text: Here’s an idea. QUIT SUBSIDIZING ANY OF IT! The market is forcing the change we all should want toward renewables. Let it. For crying out LET IT!
Awesome Article

paragraphs.name: da8b
paragraphs.text: As mentioned by many already. The renewable energy problem is solved now as it gained traction on the markets (people realized there is money to make there) so a lot of investments are now done torwards renewable energy research and nothing can stop it now. We can move our focus elsewhere now, this thing is taken care of. Thanks for the article, nice to see the numbers!

virtuals.subtitle: And in many places, coal is no longer competitive, people just have to get over it.

4baa82459f7f.title: Renewable energy has certainly a bright future.

content.subtitle: And in many places, coal is no longer competitive, people just have to get over it.

paragraphs.name: c9e4
paragraphs.text: Renewable energy has certainly a bright future. This said, it faces certain challenges to be deployed on a large scale, such as reliability. If this cannot be solved, there will be an upper limit to how much it can be deployed. Of course, these challenges are well known and are being addressed by smart people.

b160d98c935.title: Rather than emphasising storage (batteries), we should look to long distance direct current power…

paragraphs.name: 4ee0
paragraphs.text: Rather than emphasising storage (batteries), we should look to long distance direct current power lines to transfer solar/wind power produced mostly in the great planes and southern dessert to the populous markets and distribute power across time zones.

d4b146a170b8.title: This further confirms what Dr Romm told his audience in Denver in September.

paragraphs.name: 34a6
paragraphs.text: This further confirms what Dr Romm told his audience in Denver in September. If you haven’t watched Romm’s concise presentation yet I highly recommend it. He puts it in the context of climate change solutions and argues that the momentum of the renewable energy revolution is coming faster than most people are aware: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P6ag3b1WCYc

paragraphs.text: the renewables revolution is powered by advances in nano technology. nanotech reduces costs and increases market adoption. as an example it is now possible to use galfenol and zinc oxide to harness sound energy (infrasound) from beach surf to make hydrogen fuel. see www.youtube.com/user/endingoil777/videos

content.subtitle: CO2 is a “trace gas” in air and is insignificant by definition. It would have to be increased by a factor of 2500 to be considered…

paragraphs.text: This is all ridiculous and the facts are simple:

paragraphs.name: ed8a
paragraphs.text: CO2 is a “trace gas” in air and is insignificant by definition. It would have to be increased by a factor of 2500 to be considered “significant” or “notable.” To give it the great power claimed is a crime against physical science.

The world has spoken and the deniers attempting to hold back change are going to be left out. This is out of need. The world is in motion. The transitions are being made. Keep up the good work.

623fb54e4696.title: Why do conservative Republicans hold on to outmoded concepts like coal for dear life — serving…

content.subtitle: It requires a well developed intellect to override the conservative ego, and by definition conservatives lack such intellect, so they are…

paragraphs.name: 636e
paragraphs.text: Why do conservative Republicans hold on to outmoded concepts like coal for dear life — serving vested interests. It is very simple. The ego is the most primitive and conservative part of the mind. Once it latches on to an idea it fights tooth and nail to see to it that its initial assessment is not changed.

a76954e8f7fb.title: The world needs to give a big thank you to all the scientists, engineers, technicians, solar…

paragraphs.name: 286f
paragraphs.text: The world needs to give a big thank you to all the scientists, engineers, technicians, solar advocates and brave legislators that worked to make solar feasible. They ignored the naysayers and beat back the vested (fossil fuel) interests and turned the dream into reality.

d3c8d878023f.title: What are the cost comparisons in the United States only?

paragraphs.name: 947c
paragraphs.text: What are the cost comparisons in the United States only? Or what is the worldwide cost average of conventional electricity to solar?

4f22df4e295d.title: The question I have from your data are those peak performance months (i.e.

paragraphs.name: 346d
paragraphs.text: The question I have from your data are those peak performance months (i.e. Most optimal solar and wind time of year)? What is the average annual rate would be a better impartial metric as a comparator. Someone also mentioned wholesale price vs. retail price as an issue as well. Finally, are these scalable and to what level (e.g. Physical space limitation, storage limitation, etc).
